name: MFMessageComposeViewController
desc: A standard view controller whose interface lets the user compose and send SMS or MMS messages.

items.name: var messageComposeDelegate: MFMessageComposeViewControllerDelegate?
items.desc: The delegate to which message-related notifications should be sent.

items.name: protocol MFMessageComposeViewControllerDelegate
items.desc: An interface for responding to user interactions with a message compose view controller.

items.name: class func canSendText() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the current device is capable of sending text messages.

items.name: class func canSendAttachments() -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether or not messages can include attachments.

items.name: class func canSendSubject() -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether or not messages can include subject lines, according to the userâ€™s configuration in Settings.

items.name: class func isSupportedAttachmentUTI(String) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether or not the message can accept a file, with the specified UTI, as an attachment.

items.name: var recipients: [String]?
items.desc: An array of strings that contains the initial recipients of the message.

items.name: var subject: String?
items.desc: The initial subject of the message.

items.name: var body: String?
items.desc: The initial content of the message.

items.name: var message: MSMessage?
items.desc: A message object from your iMessage app extension.

items.name: func disableUserAttachments()
items.desc: Disables the camera/attachment button in the message composition view.

items.name: var attachments: [[AnyHashable : Any]]?

items.desc: The URL for the item that is attached to the message.

items.desc: The key for the alternate filename for the file-based item attached to the message.
